testsuite.name: API
testsuite.details: Testing of TL feature via API

testcase.name: set exec result - test plan WITHOUT PLATFORMS
set exec result - test plan WITH WRONG PLATFORM NAME
set exec result - test plan WITH WRONG PLATFORM ID
Create Build - "easy" - NO RELEASE DATE
testcase.summary: fill in data with values that do not generate error/conflicts

testcase.name: Create Build - "easy" - WITH RELEASE DATE
testcase.summary: fill in data with values that do not generate error/conflicts

testcase.name: Create issue tracker - NAME Collision
testcase.summary:
Create a issue tracker with a name that will generate collision.

TL has to provide clear and human readeble, feedback message

issue tracker attributes Type and Configuration, has to be preserved after feedback messages

Check non event on TL event viewer

testcase.name: Edit issue tracker - NAME Collision
testcase.summary: Similar to 'Create issue tracker - NAME Collision'

testcase.name: Delete issue tracker
testcase.summary:
Check that 'delete icon' is present ONLY if issue tracker has not be linked to test project.

Value of Active attribute on issue tracker integration on test project IS IGNORED

testcase.name: List all available issue trackers
testcase.summary: Check that 'delete icon' is present ONLY for issue trackers NON linked to test project

testcase.name: EXPORT - Go back management
testcase.summary: create a custom field, then click export, then click cancel

testcase.name: IMPORT - Go back management
testcase.summary: create a custom field, then click export, then click cancel

testcase.name: User filter
testcase.summary: Try to displays event filtered by one or several users.

testcase.name: Date filter
testcase.summary: Try to display events filtered by date.

testcase.name: Level filter
testcase.summary: Try to display events filtered by level.

testcase.name: Multi-filtering
testcase.summary: Try to display events filtered by all conbination between User, Level and date.

testcase.name: Deleting events
testcase.summary: Try to delete events filtered by all conbination between User, Level and date or not filtered.

testcase.name: Test Project name in NAVBAR
testcase.summary:
controlled by:
[navBar] TESTPROJECT_TRUNCATE_SIZE=50

testcase.name: Test Plan name
testcase.summary: [mainPage] TESTPLAN_TRUNCATE_SIZE=45

testsuite.name: On limit login tests
testsuite.details: This test suite is focused on verifiying behaviour of Testlink login under out of limit values

testcase.name: Unicode values
testcase.summary: Try to set Login / Password with real Unicode values.

testcase.name: Long values
testcase.summary: Try to set Login / Password with very long strings (> 2048 chars).

testcase.name: Empty values
testcase.summary: Try to set Login / Password with empty or invisible (as #255 ascii char ) values.

testcase.name: Code values
testcase.summary: Try to set Login / Password with HTML or PHP or JS codes inline.

testsuite.name: Online Documentation
testsuite.details: Access to Documentation included on test link distribution

testcase.name: Display any document
testcase.summary: Choose a document and display it

testcase.name: Create Platform with Existent NAME
testcase.summary: Create Platform that have same NAME that existent ONE on this test project => Conflict

testcase.name: Create Platform without Conflicts
testcase.summary: Create Platform without Conflicts

testcase.name: Add ONE platform to ZERO Platform Test plan
testcase.summary: Check effects of adding ONE platform to a test plan that HAS NO Platforms, after test plan has been populated with test cases, and some test cases has been executed.
testcase.preconditions: Have a test plan with test cases and some test cases executed

testcase.name: Save Platform Assignament WITH RIGHT PANEL EMPTY
testcase.summary: Verify that saving platform assignment with RIGHT PANEL empty does not create problems

testcase.name: Create NEW VERSION - Source Version 1
testcase.summary: Create Req Choose version 1 and create new version

testcase.name: Create NEW VERSION - Source Version <> 1
testcase.summary:
Create a Req.

Create several versions 1,2,3, making content of every version different

Choose version 2 => create a new version

testcase.name: CSV Import - No conflict
testcase.summary: Import a CVS that has a contain that assure no conflict will be generated by import. Fill User interface in following way: Leave combo "Set conflict solution" with it's default value [ ] Do not import items with empty Scope

testcase.name: CVS Import - CONFLICT - UPDATE
testcase.summary: Re-Import a CVS file, in this way you will create a conflict. Fill User interface in following way: combo "Set conflict solution" => UPDATE [ ] Do not import items with empty Scope

testcase.name: CVS Import - CONFLICT - SKIP
testcase.summary: Re-Import a CVS file, in this way you will create a conflict. Fill User interface in following way: combo "Set conflict solution" => SKIP [ ] Do not import items with empty Scope

testcase.name: Create Self Relation - KO
testcase.summary: Creating a relation from REQ A to REQ A is not allowed => message must be displayed to user

testcase.name: Create Relation easy 1 when 0 relations exists
testcase.summary: easy means create a relation that will not have problems, for a REQ that has no relation defined

testcase.name: Create Relation easy 2 when relations exists
testcase.summary: easy means create a relation that will not have problems, for a REQ that has relations defined

testsuite.name: Search Test Cases - Simple from TOP MENU BAR
Test Case Assignment to TEST PLAN

testcase.name: Assign test case and also tester on same operation

step.actions:
Login to test link

Create a test project

Create Test Spec importing using sample present on

[TL install dir]\docs\qa_data\simple_with_platforms\testproject-2ts-4tc.xml
step.expectedresults: test spec with two test suites each with a child test suite, with two test cases inside each childe test suite

step.actions:
Create at least 4 users (you can use SQL script present on

[TL_install_dir]\docs\qa_data\formula_one.sql or formula_one_mysql.sql)

Use link on main screen ' Add / Remove Test Cases'

select child test suite

on right screen check first test case,

select a use and a build

(see attached image screen before ...)

step.expectedresults:
after submit you will see NO INFO ABOUT tester assignment,

but row with selected test case on step 4, will change color to yellow (see screen AFTER ....)

step.actions:
Go to feature ' Assign Test Case Execution'

look for test case used on step 4
step.expectedresults:
you will see that user is assigned

(see image screen of Assign Execution feature)

testsuite.name: Filter by Execution STATUS = NOT RUN
testsuite.details:
Not run is an special execution status, because NO RECORD IS WRITTEN into DB. For this reason is much more easier to written wrong queries.

Special care has to be put on this kind of test cases

testcase.name: Filter by Execution status NOT RUN - 1B0P
testcase.summary:
Not run is an special execution status, because NO RECORD IS WRITTEN into DB. For this reason is much more easier to written wrong queries.

Special care has to be put on this kind of test cases
testcase.preconditions: Test Plan has to have:  Just One Build (1B), No Platforms (0P)

step.actions:
Create Test Project -> ISSUE 5131
Create Test Plan-> Test Plan 1 - NO PLATFORMS
Create Build -> 501122
Create user -> user1 , role->senior tester
Create Test suite A and test cases TC1 to TC5
Add test cases and assign test cases to user1
Login with user1 credential
Go to -> Test execution
Mark Test case TC1 as Passed
Go to filters-> Select in Results->"Not Run" filter
step.expectedresults: It should display 4 test cases as not run

testcase.name: Filter by Execution status NOT RUN - 1B1P
testcase.summary:
Not run is an special execution status, because NO RECORD IS WRITTEN into DB. For this reason is much more easier to written wrong queries.

Special care has to be put on this kind of test cases
testcase.preconditions: Test Plan has to have:  Just One Build (1B),  Just One Platform (1P)

step.actions:
Create Test Project -> ISSUE 5131


Create Test Plan-> Test Plan 2 - ON" PLATFORM


Create Build -> 501122


Create Platform -> VxWorks


Assigne Plaform to Test Plan


Create user -> user1 , role->senior tester


Create Test suite A and test cases TC1 to TC5


Add test cases and assign test cases to user1


Login with user1 credential


Go to -> Test execution


Mark Test case TC1 as Passed


Go to filters-> Select in Results->"Not Run" filter
step.expectedresults: It should display 4 test cases as not run

testsuite.name: Test Project Management
testsuite.details:
All test project management feature.

Remember to test with and without platforms

testcase.name: Create FIRST Test Project - TEMPLATE OFF
testcase.summary: After a FRESH Install, create the first test project

testcase.name: Create FIRST Test Project - TEMPLATE ON
testcase.summary: After a FRESH Install, create the first test project

testcase.name: Create Test Project - No conflict
testcase.summary: Create a Test project with all required information, without creating any conflict (use a test project name not present on system, use a PREFIX not present on system)

testcase.name: Rename Test Project - NO NAME CONFLICT
Set Test Project INACTIVE
testcase.summary:
Choose an ACTIVE test project

Set INACTIVE

Choose again same test project

Set ACTIVE

testcase.name: Delete EMPTY Test Project
testcase.summary: Delete a test projects that has NOTHING INSIDE

testcase.name: Delete Test Project WITHOUT PLATFORMS
testcase.summary: Delete a test projects that has NO PLATFORMS DEFINED

testcase.name: Delete Test Project WITH PLATFORMS NOT ASSIGNED
testcase.summary: Delete a test projects that has PLATFORMS DEFINED, BUT NOT ASSIGNED TO ANY TEST PLANS

testcase.name: Delete Test Project WORST CASE
testcase.summary:
Delete a test projects that has:

Custom fields, Keywords

platform defined an assigned to test plans

Test cases with custom fields

testcase.name: Delete Test Project with N Empty Test Suites
testcase.summary:
Create a Test Project that has many test suites, but all are empty.

Test Project has:

 

. no platforms

. no keywords

. no custom fields

. no requirements

. no inventory items

. no test plans

. no builds

. no milestones

testsuite.name: Test Suite Management
testsuite.details: Create, Edit, Delete, Copy, Move, Import, Export operations

testcase.name: Copy EMPTY Test Suite Simple
testcase.summary:
Simple Means: 

No keywords assigned

No Custom Fields

testcase.name: Move EMPTY Test Suite via DRAG & DROP
Move NOT EMPTY Test Suite via DRAG & DROP
Rename Test Suite 'Easy'
testcase.summary: easy means NO NAME CONFLICT

testcase.name: Copy EMPTY Test Suite + KEYWORDS
testcase.summary:
Test suite has to have keywords assigned.

No Custom Fields

testcase.name: Copy EMPTY Test Suite + CUSTOM FIELDS
testcase.summary:
Test suite has to have Custom Fields 

NO keywords assigned.

testcase.name: Copy EMPTY Test Suite + KEYWORDS + CUSTOM FIELDS
testcase.summary: Test suite has to have keywords and Custom Fields  assigned

testcase.name: Export Test Suite XML simple
testcase.summary: simple means Test Suite contains ONLY test cases Test Suite has NO keyword assigned Test Suite has NO Custom Fields Test Cases has NO keyword assigned Test Cases has NO Custom Fields

testcase.name: Export Test Suite XML with keywords
testcase.summary: simple means Test Suite contains ONLY test cases Test Suite has keywords assigned Test Suite has NO Custom Fields Test Cases has NO keyword assigned Test Cases has NO Custom Fields

testcase.name: Delete Test Case that has NO STEPS
testcase.summary: Create a test case DO NOT ADD STEPS Delete

testcase.name: Copy Test Case - Dest: Same Test Suite TOP
Copy Test Case - Dest: Same Test Suite BOTTOM
testcase.summary:
Copy Keywords: NO

Copy Requirements: NO

testcase.name: Create Test Case Step - easy
testcase.summary: easy means without generation errors or conflicts

Use link to other test case
testcase.summary: check how windows i opened

testsuite.name: User control of refresh tree after each operation

testcase.name: Request Update of SINGLE Test Case
testcase.summary: 1. Create some testcases with multiple versions and add to a testplan 2. Click Link "Update Linked Test Case Versions" 3. Expand Tree to Testcase level 4. Select single Testcase

testcase.name: Request Update for a Test Suite

testsuite.name: User Execution Assignment
testsuite.details: Work on test case versions assigned to test plan, and assign users responsible of execution (testers)

testcase.name: Assignment of execution to user (with platforms)
testcase.summary: Test execute assignment to user
testcase.preconditions:
Test plan with a least one test case.

At least two users.

At least two platforms connected to the test plan

step.actions: Assign a test case on platform A to a user A and the same test case but platform B to user B
step.expectedresults: Test case platform A is assigned to user A and platform B is assigned to user B

step.actions: Reassign a test case to another user
step.expectedresults: Test case is assigned to the other user

testcase.name: Assignment of execution to user [2]
testcase.summary: Test execute assignment to user
testcase.preconditions:
Test plan with a least one test case.

At least two users.

No platforms in use for the test plan.

step.actions: Assign a test case to a user
step.expectedresults: Test case is assigned to the user

step.actions: Reassign a test case to another user
step.expectedresults: Test case is assigned to the other user
